intro: Ophiorrhiza loana, commonly known as the slender sandalwood or the white sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release seeds when mature. Ophiorrhiza loana is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or nutrient-poor soils.
